channel.title: Scrublands
channel.desc: Martin finds the link between Byron and his victims. Contains strong language and some violent scenes.

channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Sitcom about a couple who try to live self-sufficiently in Surbiton. Tom takes the law into his own hands when some of his leeks go missing.

channel.title: Yes Minister
channel.desc: Political sitcom. Minister for administrative affairs Jim Hacker struggles to cut administrative staff in the Health Service.

channel.desc: Programme exploring the reasons behind the enduring popularity of one of Britain's greatest novelists, Jane Austen.

channel.title: Celeste at Glastonbury 2025
channel.desc: Award-winning British singer Celeste, last seen on West Holts in 2022, returns to Glastonbury's biggest stage, offering silky vocals and heartfelt lyrics from the Pyramid.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Cymande and Black Uhuru at Glastonbury 2025
channel.desc: British funk pioneers Cymande make their long-awaited Glastonbury debut, then reggae royalty Black Uhuru step up with a set spanning more than five decades.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Snow Patrol and St Vincent at Glastonbury 2025
channel.desc: A Glastonbury double bill featuring performances by Snow Patrol and St Vincent.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Prodigy at Glastonbury 2025
channel.desc: BBC Four's Glastonbury coverage closes with original rave pioneers The Prodigy, in their first appearance at the festival since the death of frontman Keith Flint in 2019.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Punk at the BBC
channel.desc: An archive celebration of BBC studio performances from the British bands that broke through courtesy of punk, with Dr Feelgood, Buzzcocks, Joy Division and many more.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Being Beethoven
channel.desc: As Beethoven embarks on the extraordinary flowering of his late music, his health deteriorates and his desire for love and family tips over into obsession.

channel.title: Beethoven's Fidelio
channel.desc: Antonio Pappano introduces a production of Beethoven's only opera, a story of risk and triumph against a backdrop of revolution, starring Lise Davidsen and David Butt Philip.

channel.title: Albert Speer
